dict.string: Sets a label color for selected files and directories

cat << EOF <?xml version='1.0'?><items> <item uid='none' arg='none' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>None</title> <subtitle>Removes label</subtitle> <icon>colors/none.png</icon> </item> <item uid='orange' arg='orange' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Orange</title> <subtitle>Applies the orange label</subtitle> <icon>colors/orange.png</icon> </item> <item uid='red' arg='red' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Red</title> <subtitle>Applies the red label</subtitle> <icon>colors/red.png</icon> </item> <item uid='yellow' arg='yellow' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Yellow</title> <subtitle>Applies the yellow label</subtitle> <icon>colors/yellow.png</icon> </item> <item uid='blue' arg='blue' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Blue</title> <subtitle>Applies the blue label</subtitle> <icon>colors/blue.png</icon> </item> <item uid='purple' arg='purple' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Purple</title> <subtitle>Applies the purple label</subtitle> <icon>colors/purple.png</icon> </item> <item uid='green' arg='green' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Green</title> <subtitle>Applies the green label</subtitle> <icon>colors/green.png</icon> </item> <item uid='gray' arg='gray' valid='yes' autocomplete=''> <title>Gray</title> <subtitle>Applies the gray label</subtitle> <icon>colors/gray.png</icon> </item> </items> EOF
none (removes label), orange, red, yellow, blue, purple, green, gray

File action to set the label color for the chosen files and/or directories.
Use Alfred to pick what you want to apply (or remove) a label to and pick `Label` as the action, or use the keyboard shortcut. Alfred’s main window will appear and you simply select an option or type to filter the color’s name.
